alert.note: Alert for Beadle; Davison; Hanson; Lake; McCook; Miner; Minnehaha; Moody; Sanborn (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 1:50PM MST until February 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 16 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Minnesota and east central and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero Thursday could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... The greatest risk for blizzard conditions will occur early Wednesday into early Thursday.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Beadle; Davison; Hanson; Lake; McCook; Miner; Minnehaha; Moody; Sanborn
